definition: life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: He straightened himself up, and rooted himself upon that point of support with a sort of fury.
sentences.chinese: 他竖起身来又弯下去，拚命在这个支点上站稳。

sentences.english: Mark churned wildly through the muck trying to keep up.
sentences.chinese: 马克在污泥中拚命摇晃着努力保持平衡。

sentences.english: The group huddled together and prayer hard.
sentences.chinese: 大家挤作一团拚命祈祷。

sentences.english: But after that I began to work hard.
sentences.chinese: 不过，打那以后，我开始拚命工作。

sentences.english: He s swotting every evening for his Bar exams .
sentences.chinese: 他每晚都在拚命用功准备参加律师考试。

sentences.english: At such times he seemed to bear money a grudge and spent it recklessly .
sentences.chinese: 在这种时候，他仿佛跟钱有仇似的，拚命的乱花。

sentences.english: All his life he's struggled to prove them wrong.
sentences.chinese: 他一生都在拚命去证明他们错了。

sentences.english: They faked the fall and then picked themselves up and ran hard.
sentences.chinese: 他们假装中弹倒下，然后爬起来拚命跑。

sentences.english: He took his life in his hands when he killed the Philistine. The LORD won a great victory for all Israel, and you saw it and were glad.
sentences.chinese: 他拚命杀那非利士人，耶和华为以色列众人大行拯救。

sentences.english: My students are working their fingers to the bone preparing for their final examination.
sentences.chinese: 我的学生都在拚命工作，为准备期终考而努力。

definition: see 咬緊牙關|咬紧牙关[yao3 jin3 ya2 guan1]
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
to beg for mercy/to ask for forgiveness
